intro: Banksia baueri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved banksia, is a flowering plant native to southwestern Western Australia. It is part of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical inflorescence, which consists of numerous yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and sandy soils, thriving in full sun conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it produces woody follicles that contain seeds. Banksia baueri is well adapted to the region's dry climate and is an important component of the local flora.
